wikipedia_page.main:
Josh O'Connor (born 20 May 1990)  is a British actor. He is known for his portrayal of young Prince Charles in the Netflix drama The Crown (2019–2020), for which he won the Golden Globe Award for Best Actor – Television Series Drama and the Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series in 2021 and was nominated for the British Academy Television Award for Best Supporting Actor in 2020 and the British Academy Television Award for Best Actor in 2021.
He is also known for his role as Johnny Saxby in Francis Lee's God's Own Country, for which he won a British Independent Film Award for Best Actor, and as Lawrence Durrell in the ITV series The Durrells. He also appeared as Marius Pontmercy in BBC One's miniseries of Victor Hugo's novel Les Misérables.
